original_solution_mapping.L1: There were 30 + 20 = <<30+20=50>>50 attendees at the party.
original_solution_mapping.L2: A total of 50 x 2/5 = <<50*2/5=20>>20 people left the party.
original_solution_mapping.L3: Nine of those who left were men while 20 - 9 = <<20-9=11>>11 of them were women.
original_solution_mapping.L4: So, 30 - 11= <<30-11=19>>19 women stayed at the party.
original_solution_mapping.L5: And 20 - 9 = <<20-9=11>>11 men stayed at the party.
original_solution_mapping.L6: Thus, 19 - 11 = <<19-11=8>>8 more women than men stayed at the party.

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 3174.
    Returns: the difference in the number of women and men who stayed at the party.
    """
    # L1
    women_attendees = 30 # 30 women
    men_attendees = 20 # 20 men
    total_attendees = women_attendees + men_attendees

    # L2
    fraction_left = Fraction(2, 5) # 2/5 of the total number of people left
    people_left = total_attendees * fraction_left

    # L3
    men_left = 9 # 9 men left the party
    women_left = people_left - men_left

    # L4
    women_stayed = women_attendees - women_left

    # L5
    men_stayed = men_attendees - men_left

    # L6
    women_more_than_men = women_stayed - men_stayed

    # FA
    answer = women_more_than_men
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: There were {women_attendees} + {men_attendees} = <<{women_attendees}+{men_attendees}={total_attendees}>>{total_attendees} attendees at the party.
A total of {total_attendees} x {fraction_left} = <<{total_attendees}*{fraction_left}={people_left}>>{people_left} people left the party.
Nine of those who left were men while {people_left} - {men_left} = <<{people_left}-{men_left}={women_left}>>{women_left} of them were women.
So, {women_attendees} - {women_left}= <<{women_attendees}-{women_left}={women_stayed}>>{women_stayed} women stayed at the party.
And {men_attendees} - {men_left} = <<{men_attendees}-{men_left}={men_stayed}>>{men_stayed} men stayed at the party.
Thus, {women_stayed} - {men_stayed} = <<{women_stayed}-{men_stayed}={women_more_than_men}>>{women_more_than_men} more women than men stayed at the party.

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L1: There were 30 + 20 = <<30+20=50>>50 attendees at the party.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: A total of 50 x 2/5 = <<50*2/5=20>>20 people left the party.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L3: Nine of those who left were men while 20 - 9 = <<20-9=11>>11 of them were women.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L4: So, 30 - 11= <<30-11=41>>41 women stayed at the party.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L5: And 20 - 9 = <<20-9=11>>11 men stayed at the party.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L6: Thus, 41 - 11 = <<41-11=30>>30 more women than men stayed at the party.

explanation: Incorrect operation. The calculation should use '-' but used '+' instead.
